title: Tarakeswar (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Tarakeswar Vidhan Sabha constituency is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Hooghly%20district">Hooghly district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the Delimitation Commission, No. 198 <a href="Tarakeswar">Tarakeswar</a> Vidhan Sabha constituency, also spelt Tarakeshwar, is composed of the following: <a href="Tarakeswar%20Municipality">Tarakeswar Municipality</a>, <a href="Tarakeswar%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Tarakeswar</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a>, and Bhanderhati I, Bhanderhati II, Gopinathpur I, Gopinathpur II and Perambua Sahabazar <a href="gram%20panchayat">gram panchayat</a>s of <a href="Dhaniakhali%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Dhaniakhali</a> community development block.
Tarakeswar (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of No. 29 <a href="Arambagh%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Arambagh (Lok Sabha constituency)</a> (SC).
Election results.
2011.
In the 2011 election, Rachpal Singh of Trinamool Congress defeated his nearest rival Pratim Chatterjee of MFB.
2006.
In the 2006 election, Pratim Chatterjee of CPIM-Marxist Forward Bloc Supported Independent defeated his nearest rival Krishna Bhattacharje of BJP.
2001.
In the 2001 election, Pratim Chatterjee of CPIM-Marxist Forward Bloc Supported Independent defeated his nearest rival Krishna Bhattacharje of BJP.
1977-2006.
Tarakeswar has been a base of <a href="Marxist%20Forward%20Bloc">Marxist Forward Bloc</a> but officially their candidates are often shown as Independent. In 1996, the candidate was shown as belonging to <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">CPI(M)</a>. In <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006</a>, 2001 and 1996, Pratim Chatterjee, Independent/ CPI(M), won the 185 Tarakeswar assembly seat defeating Krishna Bhattacharjee of <a href="Bharatiya%20Janata%20Party">BJP</a> in 2006, Mohan Ghosh of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 2001 and Ajit Kumar Ghosh of Congress in 1996. Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. Santi Chatterjee, Independent, defeated Balailal Sheth of Congress in 1991 and 1987. Ram Chatterjee, Independent, defeated Bimal Kanti Ghosh of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress%20%28Socialist%29">ICS</a> in 1982. and Ajit Bose Mullik of <a href="Janata%20Party">Janata Party</a> in 1977.
1951-1972.
Balai Lal Sheth of Congress won in 1972. Ram Chatterjee of Marxist Forward Block/ Independent won in 1971, 1969 and 1967. Parbati Charan Hazra of Congress won in <a href="1962%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1962</a>, <a href="1957%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1957</a> and in <a href="1952%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">independent India's first election in 1951</a>.
